content.question: Which of the following diagrams best represents hormone-activated gene expression?

choices.label: The figure shows a cell with multiple components. A steroid hormone is shown outside of the cell, and there is an arrow from the steroid hormone to a receptor molecule located inside the cell. The combination of the steroid hormone and the receptor molecule is shown in the cell both inside and outside of the nucleus and is labeled hormone-receptor complex. Inside the nucleus is a strand of D N A labeled transcription. Outside the nucleus a strand of R N A touching the nucleus is labeled translation.

The figure shows a cell with multiple components. A peptide hormone is shown outside of the cell, and there is an arrow from the peptide hormone to an unnamed molecule located inside the cell. The combination of the peptide hormone and the unnamed molecule is shown in the cell both inside and outside of the nucleus and is labeled peptide/ D N A complex. Inside the nucleus is a strand of D N A labeled transduction. Outside the nucleus a strand of R N A touching the nucleus is labeled translation.

The figure shows a cell with multiple components. An A T P molecule is shown outside of the cell, and there is an arrow from the A T P molecule to a kinase molecule located inside the cell. The combination of the A T P molecule and the kinase molecule is shown in the cell both inside and outside of the nucleus and is labeled A T P/kinase complex. Inside the nucleus is a strand of D N A labeled translocation. Outside the nucleus a strand of R N A touching the nucleus is labeled induction.

The figure shows a cell with multiple components. A cholesterol molecule is shown outside of the cell, and there is an arrow from the cholesterol molecule to a peptidoglycan molecule located inside the cell. The combination of the cholesterol molecule and the peptidoglycan molecule is shown in the cell both inside and outside of the nucleus and is labeled initiation complex. Inside the nucleus is a strand of D N A labeled transformation. Outside the nucleus a strand of R N A touching the nucleus is labeled exocytosis.
